intro: Senecio lugens var. parryi, commonly known as Parry's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, hairy stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as gravelly slopes and dry grasslands.
